Description: PharMerica Corporation agreed to pay the United States $31.5 million to resolve a lawsuit alleging that it violated the Controlled Substances Act by dispensing Schedule II controlled drugs without a valid prescription and violated the False Claims Act by submitting false claims to Medicare for these improperly dispensed drugs.
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/long-term-care-pharmacy-pay-315-million-settle-lawsuit-alleging-violations-controlled

Description: Nursing home pharmacy company PharMerica Corp. agreed to pay $9.25 million to resolve allegations that it solicited and received kickbacks from pharmaceutical manufacturer Abbott Laboratories in exchange for promoting the prescription drug Depakote for nursing home patients.
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/nations-second-largest-nursing-home-pharmacy-pay-925-million-settle-kickback-allegations

Description: The HHS Office of Inspector General announced a settlement agreement with PharMerica, Inc., and its subsidiary, PharMerica Drug Systems Inc., resolving allegations of illegal kickbacks paid in violation of the Civil Monetary Penalties Law (CMPL). Under the terms of settlement, PharMerica agreed to  pay $5.975 million and enter into a comprehensive five-year corporate integrity agreement.
Agency: Health & Human Services Department Office of Inspector General
Info Source: https://oig.hhs.gov/publications/docs/press/2005/032905release.pdf

Description: The Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs announced that it resolved allegations of sex discrimination by federal contractor, ResCare HomeCare Spokane. OFCCP investigators determined that ResCare's selection process violated Executive Order 11246 because it led to systemic hiring discrimination affecting men who applied for in-home care positions between June 2009 and May 2010. The investigation concluded that 77 male job applicants were denied full consideration during the hiring process.
Agency: Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs
Info Source: https://www.dol.gov/newsroom/releases/ofccp/ofccp20131572

Description: ResCare Iowa Inc. agreed to pay $5.63 million to the United States and the state of Iowa to resolve allegations that it violated the False Claims Act by submitting false home healthcare billings to the Medicare and Medicaid programs.
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/iowa-home-care-company-pay-563-million-settle-false-claims-act-allegations

Description: Nursing home pharmacy company PharMerica Corp. agreed to pay $2.5 million to settle multistate litigation alleging it solicited and received kickbacks from pharmaceutical manufacturer Abbott Laboratories in exchange for promoting the prescription drug Depakote for nursing home patients. This was part of a larger $9.25 million settlement involving the federal government; see the Violation Tracker entry at https://violationtracker.goodjobsfirst.org/violation-tracker/-pharmerica-corp
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/nations-second-largest-nursing-home-pharmacy-pay-925-million-settle-kickback-allegations

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: February 7, 2020 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.
